001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
004
005/**
006 * An interface for point hashes that are statistically biased, as well as a holder for inner classes that implement
007 * this. The point hashes here are mostly chosen because they are aesthetically interesting, at least on some of their
008 * output bits.
009 * <br>
010 * Don't count on this class giving reliable output; it is marked Beta and will remain so. If you want to ensure a
011 * particular behavior of a FlawedPointHash can be replicated, copy the implementation into your own code.
012 * <br>
013 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 4/14/2020.
014 */
015@Beta
016public interface FlawedPointHash extends IPointHash, IFlawed {
017    /**
018     * Produces hashes that show strong bias on one axis (usually the later axes matter more) and have nice-looking
019     * patterns of dots. Better patterns are present in the higher bits.
020     */
021    class RugHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
022        public RugHash() {
023        }
024
025        public RugHash(long state) {
026            super(state);
027        }
028
029        public long getState() {
030            return state;
031        }
032
033        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
034            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
035            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
036            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
037            return (int) (s >>> 32);
038        }
039
040        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
041            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
042            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
043            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
044            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
045            return (int) (s >>> 32);
046        }
047
048        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
049            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + w);
050            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
051            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
052            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
053            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (w + z);
054            return (int) (s >>> 32);
055        }
056
057        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long s) {
058            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + u);
059            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
060            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
061            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
062            u = (u + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ u) * (w + z);
063            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (u + w);
064            return (int) (s >>> 32);
065        }
066
067        public static int hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
068            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + v);
069            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
070            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
071            w = (w + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ w) * (z + y);
072            u = (u + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ u) * (w + z);
073            v = (v + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ v) * (u + w);
074            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (v + u);
075            return (int) (s >>> 32);
076        }
077
078        @Override
079        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
080            return hashLongs(x, y, state);
081        }
082
083        @Override
084        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
085            return hashLongs(x, y, z, state);
086        }
087
088        @Override
089        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
090            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state);
091        }
092
093        @Override
094        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
095            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, state);
096        }
097
098        @Override
099        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
100            return hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state);
101        }
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Extremely flawed if you're using this as a point hash, but meant to be aesthetically interesting, this produces
106     * different symmetrical patterns in squares, as if on a quilt.
107     */
108    class QuiltHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
109        private int size = 6;
110        private long mask = (1L << size) - 1L;
111        public QuiltHash() {
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * The same as calling {@link #QuiltHash(long, int)} with size = 64 .
116         * @param state the state to use for hashing when no state is otherwise specified
117         */
118        public QuiltHash(long state) {
119            super(state);
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Creates a QuiltHash with the given state and a size for each "quilt square" equal to size, rounded up to the
124         * next power of two if it is not already a power of two. These quilt squares become quilt cubes in 3D.
125         * @param state the state to use for hashing when no state is otherwise specified
126         * @param size the size of each quilt square/cube, in no particular unit, but larger sizes can be more complex
127         */
128        public QuiltHash(long state, int size) {
129            super(state);
130            setSize(size);
131        }
132
133        public long getState() {
134            return state;
135        }
136
137        public int getSize() {
138            return 1 << size;
139        }
140
141        public void setSize(int size) {
142            this.size = 32 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(Math.max(1, size));
143            mask = (1L << this.size) - 1L;
144        }
145
146        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
147            s ^= (x >> size) * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
148            s ^= (y >> size) * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL;
149            x *= x;
150            y *= y;
151            x = x >>> 1 & mask;
152            y = y >>> 1 & mask;
153            long t;
154            if (x < y) {
155                t = x;
156                x = y;
157                y = t;
158            }
159            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
160            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
161            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
162            return s;
163        }
164
165        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
166//            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, z, s), s);
167            s ^= (x >> size) * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
168            s ^= (y >> size) * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
169            s ^= (z >> size) * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
170            x = x * x >>> 1 & mask;
171            y = y * y >>> 1 & mask;
172            z = z * z >>> 1 & mask;
173            long t;
174            if (x < y) {
175                t = x;
176                x = y;
177                y = t;
178            }
179            if(x < z){
180                t = x;
181                x = z;
182                z = t;
183            }
184            if(y < z){
185                t = y;
186                y = z;
187                z = t;
188            }
189            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
190            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
191            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
192            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
193            return s;
194        }
195
196        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
197            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, w, s), s), s);
198        }
199
200        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long s) {
201            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, u, s), s), s), s);
202        }
203        
204        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
205            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, hashLongs(u, v, s), s), s), s), s);
206        }
207
208        @Override
209        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
210            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, state) >>> 32);
211        }
212
213        @Override
214        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
215            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, state) >>> 32);
216        }
217
218        @Override
219        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
220            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state) >>> 32);
221        }
222
223        @Override
224        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
225            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, state) >>> 32);
226        }
227        
228        @Override
229        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
230            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state) >>> 32);
231        }
232    }
233
234    /**
235     * Very similar to {@link QuiltHash}, but this doesn't change the pattern in different large squares, and instead
236     * repeats a square or cube of symmetric and patterned results over and over (so it can be tiled).
237     */
238    class CubeHash extends IPointHash.LongImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
239        private int size = 6;
240        private long mask = (1L << size) - 1L;
241        public CubeHash() {
242        }
243
244        public CubeHash(long state) {
245            super(state);
246        }
247
248        public CubeHash(long state, int size) {
249            super(state);
250            setSize(size);
251        }
252
253        public long getState() {
254            return state;
255        }
256
257        public int getSize() {
258            return 1 << size;
259        }
260
261        public void setSize(int size) {
262            this.size = 32 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(Math.max(1, size));
263            mask = (1L << this.size) - 1L;
264        }
265
266        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long s) {
267            x &= mask;
268            y &= mask;
269            x *= x * 0xC13FA9A902A6328FL;
270            y *= y * 0x91E10DA5C79E7B1DL;
271            x &= mask;
272            y &= mask;
273            long t;
274            if (x < y) {
275                t = x;
276                x = y;
277                y = t;
278            }
279            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + y);
280            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
281            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (y + x);
282            return s;
283        }
284
285        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long s) {
286            x &= mask;
287            y &= mask;
288            z &= mask;
289            x *= x * 0xD1B54A32D192ED03L;
290            y *= y * 0xABC98388FB8FAC03L;
291            z *= z * 0x8CB92BA72F3D8DD7L;
292            x &= mask;
293            y &= mask;
294            z &= mask;
295            long t;
296            if (x < y) {
297                t = x;
298                x = y;
299                y = t;
300            }
301            if(x < z){
302                t = x;
303                x = z;
304                z = t;
305            }
306            if(y < z){
307                t = y;
308                y = z;
309                z = t;
310            }
311            x = (x + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ x) * (s + z);
312            y = (y + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ y) * (x + s);
313            z = (z + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ z) * (y + x);
314            s = (s + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L ^ s) * (z + y);
315            return s;
316        }
317
318        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long s) {
319            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, w, s), s), s);
320        }
321
322        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long s) {
323            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, u, s), s), s), s);
324        }
325
326        public long hashLongs(long x, long y, long z, long w, long u, long v, long s) {
327            return hashLongs(x, hashLongs(y, hashLongs(z, hashLongs(w, hashLongs(u, v, s), s), s), s), s);
328        }
329
330        @Override
331        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
332            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, state) >>> 32);
333        }
334
335        @Override
336        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
337            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, state) >>> 32);
338        }
339
340        @Override
341        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
342            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, state) >>> 32);
343        }
344
345        @Override
346        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
347            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, state) >>> 32);
348        }
349
350        @Override
351        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
352            return (int)(hashLongs(x, y, z, w, u, v, state) >>> 32);
353        }
354    }
355
356    /**
357     * FNV32a is OK as a hash for bytes when used in some hash tables, but it has major issues on its low-order bits
358     * when used as a point hash (the high bits aren't much better). Unfortunately, it is not aesthetically pleasing as
359     * a point hash. Some usages might be able to use it to apply a grimy, glitchy effect.
360     */
361    class FNVHash extends IntImpl implements FlawedPointHash {
362
363        public FNVHash() {
364            super();
365        }
366
367        public FNVHash(int state) {
368            super(state);
369        }
370
371        public int getState() {
372            return state;
373        }
374        @Override
375        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int state) {
376            return ((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193;
377        }
378
379        @Override
380        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int state) {
381            return (((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193;
382        }
383
384        @Override
385        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int state) {
386            return ((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193 ^ w) * 0x1000193;
387        }
388
389        @Override
390        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int state) {
391            return (((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193
392                    ^ w) * 0x1000193 ^ u) * 0x1000193;
393        }
394
395        @Override
396        public int hashWithState(int x, int y, int z, int w, int u, int v, int state) {
397            return ((((((state ^ 0x811c9dc5 ^ x) * 0x1000193 ^ y) * 0x1000193 ^ z) * 0x1000193
398                    ^ w) * 0x1000193 ^ u) * 0x1000193 ^ v) * 0x1000193;
399        }
400    }
401}
